sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": " 

Consider the adjoining figure. It is given that CA is parallel to BD , and AC = 5 cm, AE = 3 cm, EB = 7 cm, and ED = 8 cm. Now, calculate CE and BD .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline
[Figure not drawn to scale] \\
 ", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": "$$\text{In the triangle $ACE$ and triangle $BDE$ we have}$$
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{} = \angle B 
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v2]{} \input[s1v3]{} \input[s1v4]{} = \angle BED 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": " $$\text{So, by using angle angle similarity we can write $\Delta ACE \sim \Delta BDE $}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s2v1]{} \input[s2v2]{} }{ED } = \frac{AE }{EB } = \frac{AC }{\input[s2v3]{} \input[s2v4]{} } 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{CE }{\input[s3v1]{} } = \frac{3 }{7 } = \frac{5 }{BD }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow CE = \frac{3 }{\input[s3v2]{} } \times 8 = 3.43 cm
\]

And
\[
	\Rightarrow BD = \frac{\input[s3v3]{} }{3 } \times 5 = 11.67 cm
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["A", "A", "E", "C"], "text": "$$\text{Since, CA is parallel to BD, therefore, by alternate interor angle property, we have $\angle A = \angle B$, also, since vertically opposite angles are equal, therefore, $\angle AEC = \angle BED$.}$$"}, {"data": ["C", "E", "B", "D"], "text": "$$\text{Sice, the ratio of corresponding sides in similar triangle is proportional, therefore, $\frac{CE }{ED } = \frac{AE }{EB } = \frac{AC }{BD }$}$$"}, {"data": [8, 7, 7], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values in the previous equation we get $\frac{CE }{8 } = \frac{3 }{7 } = \frac{5 }{BD }$, which upon simplification gives us $CE = \frac{3 }{7 } \times 8 = 3.43 cm$ and $BD = \frac{7 }{3 } \times 5 = 11.67 cm$ "}]
